definitions.definition: to discover, especially where a thing or person is, either unexpectedly or by searching, or to discover where to get or how to achieve something:
examples: I've just found a ten-pound note in my pocket.

definitions.definition: to realize that something exists or has happened:
examples: [ + (that) ] We came home to find (that) the cat had had kittens.

definitions.definition: to exist or be present somewhere:
examples: Many plant and animal species are found only in the rainforests.

definitions.definition: to get somewhere you are trying to reach:
examples: I had a map but I still couldn't find my way back to the hotel.
She's always finding fault with the way he works.

definitions.definition: to realize that you are in a particular situation or place, or doing a particular thing, when you did not intend to:
examples: He'll find himself with no friends at all if he carries on behaving this way.

definitions.definition: If you go somewhere or do something to find yourself, you go there or do it to discover your true character:
examples: Simon spent a year in an ashram in India to find himself.

definitions.definition: a good or valuable thing or a special person that has been discovered but was not known about before:
examples: This café's quite a find - I had no idea there was anywhere like it around here.
